- Move the chair (chair_1) → Positioned at table_1, on the north side of the table, facing the south wall.

- Move the lamp (lamp_2) → Placed on top of nightstand_2.
full_prompt:
Edit this 2D top-down floor plan. Rearrange furniture for the "Productivity Focus" style.

MOVES TO MAKE:
- Move the table (table_1) → Centered on the south wall, pushed flush against the wall directly under the two windows.
- Move the chair (chair_1) → Positioned at table_1, on the north side of the table, facing the south wall.
- Move the chair (chair_2) → Positioned at table_1, next to chair_1, also facing the south wall.
- Move the sofa (sofa_1) → Pushed flush against the center of the west wall, opposite the bed, keeping the central path clear.
- Move the artwork (artwork_1) → Mounted on the west wall, centered above sofa_1.
- Move the plant (plant_1) → Placed in the southeast corner of the room, between the desk and the bed area.
- Move the rug (rug_1) → Centered on the floor in the work zone, positioned under the front legs of table_1 and its chairs.
- Move the rug (rug_2) → Placed on the floor on the west side of bed_1, acting as a runner.
- Move the lamp (lamp_1) → Placed on top of nightstand_1.
- Move the lamp (lamp_2) → Placed on top of nightstand_2.

Keep these items in their current positions: bed, nightstand, nightstand, artwork.

RULES:
1. Output must be a 2D top-down floor plan (same style as input).
2. MOVE means ERASE from old spot, PLACE in new spot. Do NOT duplicate.
3. The room must have exactly 14 movable items: 1 table, 2 chairs, 1 sofa, 2 artworks, 1 bed, 2 nightstands, 1 plant, 2 rugs, 2 lamps.
4. Do NOT move structural elements (kitchen, bathroom, doors, windows).
5. Do NOT add any new furniture that wasn't in the original.

Edit the floor plan now.
